axis-aligned boxes are particularly efﬁcient to implement in numerical
solvers (Dost´al, 2009, chapter 5). It turns out that
examples that lie
exactly on the
margin are
examples whose
dual parameters lie
strictly inside the
box constraints,
0 <αi <C . This is
derived using the
Karush Kuhn Tucker
conditions, for
example in
Sch¨olkopf and
Smola (2002).
